greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number T(n,k) of colored integer partitions of n using all colors of a k-set such that each block of part i with multiplicity j has a pattern of i*j colors in (weakly) increasing order; triangle T(n,k), n>=0, 0<=k<=n, read by rows.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 1..140, flattened
maple: b:= proc(n, i, k) option remember; `if`(n=0, 1, `if`(i<1, 0, add((t->
b(n-t, min(n-t, i-1), k)*binomial(k+t-1, t))(i*j), j=0..n/i)))
T:= (n, k)-> add(b(n$2, k-i)*(-1)^i*binomial(k, i), i=0..k):
mathematica: b[n_, i_, k_] := b[n, i, k] = If[n == 0, 1, If[i < 1, 0, Sum[Function[t, b[n-t, Min[n-t, i-1], k] Binomial[k + t - 1, t]][i j], {j, 0, n/i}]]];
T[n_, k_] := Sum[b[n, n, k - i] (-1)^i*Binomial[k, i], {i, 0, k}];
Table[T[n, k], {n, 0, 12}, {k, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Apr 30 2020, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
xref: Columns k=0-1 give: A000007, A000041 (for n>0).
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Sep 12 2019
